content.text:
# Curate Command: $ARGUMENTS

Managing your curated command collection...

## ğŸ¯ Curation Setup

```bash
args=($ARGUMENTS)
command_file="${args[0]}"
target_category="${args[1]}"

echo "ğŸ—‚ï¸ Claude Code Command Curation"
echo "==============================="
echo "ğŸ“… Date: $(date)"
echo ""

if [ -z "$command_file" ]; then
    echo "Interactive curation mode - browse and organize your commands"
else
    echo "ğŸ“„ Command: $command_file"
    echo "ğŸ“ Target category: ${target_category:-auto-detect}"
fi
```

## ğŸ“Š Current Collection Status

```bash
echo "ğŸ“ˆ Current Curated Collection:"
echo "============================="

curated_path="$HOME/claude-code-command-hub/curated"
total_curated=0

for category in "$curated_path"/*; do
    if [ -d "$category" ]; then
        cat_name=$(basename "$category")
        count=$(find "$category" -name "*.md" 2>/dev/null | wc -l)
        total_curated=$((total_curated + count))
        
        printf "  %-15s %3d commands\n" "$cat_name:" "$count"
    fi
done

echo "  â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€"
printf "  %-15s %3d commands\n" "Total:" "$total_curated"
echo ""
```

## ğŸ” Command Processing

```bash
if [ -n "$command_file" ]; then
    # Process specific command file
    echo "ğŸ” Processing Command File:"
    echo "=========================="
    
    # Resolve full path
    if [[ "$command_file" == /* ]]; then
        full_path="$command_file"
    elif [ -f "$command_file" ]; then
        full_path="$(realpath "$command_file")"
    elif [ -f "$HOME/claude-code-command-hub/repositories/$command_file" ]; then
        full_path="$HOME/claude-code-command-hub/repositories/$command_file"
    elif [ -f "$HOME/claude-code-command-hub/testing/sandbox-*/\\.claude/commands/$(basename "$command_file")" ]; then
        # Find in test environments
        full_path=$(find "$HOME/claude-code-command-hub/testing" -name "$(basename "$command_file")" -path "*/.claude/commands/*" | head -1)
    else
        echo "âŒ Command file not found: $command_file"
        echo ""
        echo "ğŸ” Searching for similar files..."
        filename=$(basename "$command_file")
        find ~/claude-code-command-hub -name "*$filename*" -name "*.md" 2>/dev/null | head -5 | while read -r found; do
            rel_path=${found#$HOME/claude-code-command-hub/}
            echo "  ğŸ“„ $rel_path"
        done
        exit 1
    fi
    
    if [ ! -f "$full_path" ]; then
        echo "âŒ File not accessible: $full_path"
        exit 1
    fi
    
    command_name=$(basename "$full_path" .md)
    echo "âœ… Found: $full_path"
    echo "ğŸ“ Command: /$command_name"
    
    # Analyze command content for category suggestion
    if [ -z "$target_category" ]; then
        echo ""
        echo "ğŸ¤– Auto-detecting category..."
        
        content=$(cat "$full_path")
        
        # Category detection logic
        if echo "$content" | grep -qi "doc\|session\|progress\|log"; then
            suggested_category="docs"
        elif echo "$content" | grep -qi "dev\|code\|review\|build\|test"; then
            suggested_category="dev"  
        elif echo "$content" | grep -qi "project\|task\|manage"; then
            suggested_category="project"
        elif echo "$content" | grep -qi "context\|compact\|memory"; then
            suggested_category="context"
        else
            suggested_category="personal"
        fi
        
        echo "ğŸ’¡ Suggested category: $suggested_category"
        target_category="$suggested_category"
    fi
    
    # Copy to curated collection
    target_dir="$curated_path/$target_category"
    mkdir -p "$target_dir"
    
    target_file="$target_dir/$command_name.md"
    
    if [ -f "$target_file" ]; then
        echo ""
        echo "âš ï¸  Command already exists in curated collection"
        echo "ğŸ“„ Existing: $target_file"
        echo "ğŸ”„ This will overwrite the existing version"
    fi
    
    cp "$full_path" "$target_file"
    echo "âœ… Command curated successfully!"
    echo "ğŸ“ Location: $target_file"
    
else
    # Interactive browsing mode
    echo "ğŸ” Interactive Curation Mode:"
    echo "============================"
    echo ""
    echo "ğŸ“‚ Available sources to curate from:"
    echo ""
    
    # Show test results
    test_results="$HOME/claude-code-command-hub/testing"
    if [ -d "$test_results" ]; then
        tested_count=$(find "$test_results" -name "*.md" -path "*/.claude/commands/*" 2>/dev/null | wc -l)
        echo "  ğŸ§ª Tested commands: $tested_count"
        if [ "$tested_count" -gt 0 ]; then
            echo "    Recent tests:"
            find "$test_results" -name "*.md" -path "*/.claude/commands/*" -mtime -7 2>/dev/null | head -3 | while read -r test_cmd; do
                cmd_name=$(basename "$test_cmd" .md)
                test_dir=$(echo "$test_cmd" | sed 's|.*/testing/||' | sed 's|/.*||')
                echo "      - /$cmd_name (from $test_dir)"
            done
        fi
    fi
    
    # Show repositories
    echo ""
    echo "  ğŸ“š Repository commands:"
    find "$HOME/claude-code-command-hub/repositories" -name "*.md" \( -path "*/commands/*" -o -path "*/.claude/commands/*" \) 2>/dev/null | wc -l | xargs -I {} echo "    {} total available"
    
    echo ""
    echo "ğŸ’¡ Curation workflow:"
    echo "  1. Test commands: /hub:test <command-file>"
    echo "  2. Curate good ones: /hub:curate <command-file> [category]"
    echo "  3. Deploy to projects: /hub:deploy <project> <category>"
    echo ""
    echo "ğŸ¯ Example:"
    echo "  /hub:curate Claude-Command-Suite/commands/dev/code-review.md dev"
fi
```

## ğŸ“‹ Curation Guidelines

```bash
echo ""
echo "ğŸ“‹ Curation Best Practices:"
echo "=========================="
echo ""
echo "âœ… Commands worth curating:"
echo "  - Tested and working correctly"
echo "  - Useful for your workflow"
echo "  - Well-documented with clear descriptions"
echo "  - Safe to run (no dangerous operations)"
echo ""
echo "ğŸ“ Category guidelines:"
echo "  - docs: Documentation, session management, logging"
echo "  - dev: Code analysis, development tools, testing"
echo "  - project: Project management, task organization"
echo "  - context: Context management, memory tools"
echo "  - personal: Your custom commands and modifications"
echo ""
echo "ğŸ”„ Maintenance:"
echo "  - Review curated commands periodically"
echo "  - Update commands when source repositories change"
echo "  - Remove commands that become obsolete"
```

## ğŸ“Š Collection Analysis

```bash
if [ "$total_curated" -gt 0 ]; then
    echo ""
    echo "ğŸ“ˆ Collection Analysis:"
    echo "======================"
    
    # Find most recent additions
    echo "ğŸ†• Recent additions (last 7 days):"
    recent_count=$(find "$curated_path" -name "*.md" -mtime -7 2>/dev/null | wc -l)
    if [ "$recent_count" -gt 0 ]; then
        find "$curated_path" -name "*.md" -mtime -7 2>/dev/null | while read -r recent_cmd; do
            cmd_name=$(basename "$recent_cmd" .md)
            category=$(basename "$(dirname "$recent_cmd")")
            echo "  - /$category:$cmd_name"
        done
    else
        echo "  No commands added in the last 7 days"
    fi
    
    # Suggest actions
    echo ""
    echo "ğŸ’¡ Suggestions:"
    if [ "$total_curated" -lt 5 ]; then
        echo "  ğŸ¯ Build your collection: Use /hub:discover and /hub:test"
    elif [ "$total_curated" -lt 15 ]; then
        echo "  ğŸ“ˆ Growing nicely: Consider /hub:deploy to start using commands"
    else
        echo "  ğŸ‰ Mature collection: Regularly /hub:deploy to projects"
    fi
    
    # Check for deployment opportunities
    echo "  ğŸš€ Ready for deployment to projects"
fi
```

## â­ï¸ Next Steps

```bash
echo ""
echo "â­ï¸ Next Steps:"
echo "=============="
echo ""
echo "After curation:"
echo "  1. ğŸ¯ Deploy to projects: /hub:deploy <project-path> <category>"
echo "  2. ğŸ”„ Keep collection updated: /hub:sync and re-curate as needed"
echo "  3. ğŸ“Š Monitor usage: /hub:stats"
echo ""
echo "Ongoing curation:"
echo "  - Test new commands: /hub:test <command-file>"
echo "  - Browse updates: /hub:discover"
echo "  - Organize collection: Review categories periodically"
echo ""
echo "ğŸ“š Hub commands available:"
echo "  /hub:stats    - View collection statistics"
echo "  /hub:deploy   - Deploy commands to projects"
echo "  /hub:sync     - Update community repositories"
echo "  /hub:discover - Browse available commands"
```

# Claude Code Command Hub Statistics

## ğŸ“Š Hub Overview

```bash
echo "ğŸ¯ Claude Code Command Hub Statistics"
echo "====================================="
echo "ğŸ“… Generated: $(date)"
echo ""

cd ~/claude-code-command-hub

# Basic directory stats
echo "ğŸ“‚ Hub Structure:"
echo "  ğŸ“ Location: ~/claude-code-command-hub/"
echo "  ğŸ’¾ Disk Usage: $(du -sh . 2>/dev/null | cut -f1)"
echo ""
```

## ğŸ›ï¸ Repository Statistics

```bash
echo "ğŸ“š Repository Statistics:"
echo "========================"

cd repositories

repo_count=0
total_commands=0
active_repos=0

for repo_dir in */; do
    if [ -d "$repo_dir" ]; then
        repo_count=$((repo_count + 1))
        repo_name=${repo_dir%/}
        
        # Count commands in this repo
        cmd_count=$(find "$repo_dir" -name "*.md" \( -path "*/commands/*" -o -path "*/.claude/commands/*" \) 2>/dev/null | wc -l)
        
        if [ "$cmd_count" -gt 0 ]; then
            active_repos=$((active_repos + 1))
            total_commands=$((total_commands + cmd_count))
            
            # Get last update
            if [ -d "$repo_dir/.git" ]; then
                last_update=$(cd "$repo_dir" && git log -1 --format="%ad" --date=short 2>/dev/null || echo "Unknown")
                printf "  %-25s %3d commands (updated: %s)\n" "$repo_name:" "$cmd_count" "$last_update"
            else
                printf "  %-25s %3d commands (no git info)\n" "$repo_name:" "$cmd_count"
            fi
        else
            printf "  %-25s %3d commands (inactive)\n" "$repo_name:" "$cmd_count"
        fi
    fi
done

echo ""
echo "ğŸ“ˆ Repository Summary:"
echo "  ğŸ“ Total repositories: $repo_count"
echo "  âœ… Active repositories: $active_repos"
echo "  ğŸ“„ Total commands: $total_commands"
```

## ğŸ¯ Curated Collection Statistics

```bash
echo ""
echo "ğŸ—‚ï¸ Curated Collection:"
echo "======================"

cd ~/claude-code-command-hub/curated

curated_total=0
echo "  ğŸ“‹ Commands by category:"

for category in */; do
    if [ -d "$category" ]; then
        cat_name=${category%/}
        cmd_count=$(find "$category" -name "*.md" 2>/dev/null | wc -l)
        curated_total=$((curated_total + cmd_count))
        
        if [ "$cmd_count" -gt 0 ]; then
            printf "    %-15s %3d commands\n" "$cat_name:" "$cmd_count"
            
            # Show recent commands in this category
            recent=$(find "$category" -name "*.md" -mtime -30 2>/dev/null | wc -l)
            if [ "$recent" -gt 0 ]; then
                echo "      (including $recent from last 30 days)"
            fi
        fi
    fi
done

echo ""
echo "  ğŸ“Š Curated Summary:"
echo "    ğŸ“„ Total curated: $curated_total"
echo "    ğŸ“ˆ Curation rate: $(echo "scale=1; $curated_total * 100 / $total_commands" | bc 2>/dev/null || echo "N/A")% of available commands"
```

## ğŸ§ª Testing Activity

```bash
echo ""
echo "ğŸ”¬ Testing Activity:"
echo "==================="

cd ~/claude-code-command-hub/testing

# Count test environments
test_count=$(ls -1d sandbox-* 2>/dev/null | wc -l)
echo "  ğŸ§ª Active test environments: $test_count"

if [ "$test_count" -gt 0 ]; then
    echo "  ğŸ“… Recent test sessions:"
    ls -1td sandbox-* 2>/dev/null | head -5 | while read -r test_dir; do
        test_date=$(echo "$test_dir" | sed 's/sandbox-//' | sed 's/_/ /')
        echo "    - $test_date"
    done
fi

# Count test results
result_count=$(find test-results/ -name "test-*.md" 2>/dev/null | wc -l)
echo "  ğŸ“ Test reports generated: $result_count"

if [ "$result_count" -gt 0 ]; then
    echo "  ğŸ“Š Recent test activity:"
    find test-results/ -name "test-*.md" -mtime -7 2>/dev/null | wc -l | xargs -I {} echo "    {} tests in last 7 days"
fi
```

## ğŸ“ˆ Usage Patterns

```bash
echo ""
echo "ğŸ“Š Usage Patterns:"
echo "=================="

# Analyze update history
if [ -f "~/claude-code-command-hub/metadata/update-history.md" ]; then
    sync_count=$(grep -c "Synchronized" ~/claude-code-command-hub/metadata/update-history.md 2>/dev/null || echo 0)
    echo "  ğŸ”„ Total sync operations: $sync_count"
    
    # Last sync
    if [ "$sync_count" -gt 0 ]; then
        last_sync=$(grep "Synchronized" ~/claude-code-command-hub/metadata/update-history.md | tail -1 | cut -d':' -f1)
        echo "  ğŸ“… Last sync: $last_sync"
    fi
fi

# Registry info
if [ -f "~/claude-code-command-hub/metadata/command-registry.json" ]; then
    echo "  ğŸ“‹ Registry maintained: Yes"
    
    # Try to extract some stats from JSON
    if command -v jq >/dev/null 2>&1; then
        deployed=$(jq -r '.statistics.deployed_commands // 0' ~/claude-code-command-hub/metadata/command-registry.json 2>/dev/null || echo 0)
        echo "  ğŸš€ Deployed commands: $deployed"
    fi
else
    echo "  ğŸ“‹ Registry maintained: No"
fi
```

## ğŸ¯ Popular Command Categories

```bash
echo ""
echo "ğŸ”¥ Popular Command Categories (by availability):"
echo "================================================"

cd ~/claude-code-command-hub/repositories

# Analyze command patterns across all repositories
for category in dev docs project test security deploy context git; do
    count=$(find . -name "*.md" \( -path "*/commands/*" -o -path "*/.claude/commands/*" \) -exec grep -l -i "$category" {} \; 2>/dev/null | wc -l)
    if [ "$count" -gt 0 ]; then
        printf "  %-12s %3d related commands\n" "$category:" "$count"
    fi
done

echo ""
echo "ğŸ·ï¸ Common command patterns:"
git_count=$(find . -name "*.md" \( -path "*/commands/*" -o -path "*/.claude/commands/*" \) -exec grep -l -i "git\|commit\|push\|pull" {} \; 2>/dev/null | wc -l)
doc_count=$(find . -name "*.md" \( -path "*/commands/*" -o -path "*/.claude/commands/*" \) -exec grep -l -i "doc\|session\|log" {} \; 2>/dev/null | wc -l)
test_count=$(find . -name "*.md" \( -path "*/commands/*" -o -path "*/.claude/commands/*" \) -exec grep -l -i "test\|spec\|check" {} \; 2>/dev/null | wc -l)

echo "  ğŸ”§ Git/Version Control: $git_count commands"
echo "  ğŸ“š Documentation/Logging: $doc_count commands"
echo "  ğŸ§ª Testing/Validation: $test_count commands"
```

## ğŸ’¡ Recommendations

```bash
echo ""
echo "ğŸ’¡ Recommendations:"
echo "==================="

# Suggest actions based on stats
if [ "$curated_total" -eq 0 ]; then
    echo "  ğŸ¯ Start curating: Use /hub:discover to find useful commands"
    echo "  ğŸ§ª Test commands: Use /hub:test to safely evaluate commands"
elif [ "$curated_total" -gt 0 ] && [ "$curated_total" -lt 10 ]; then
    echo "  ğŸ“ˆ Growing collection: $curated_total curated commands is a good start!"
    echo "  ğŸ” Keep exploring: Use /hub:discover for more commands"
else
    echo "  ğŸ‰ Mature collection: $curated_total curated commands!"
    echo "  ğŸš€ Consider deployment: Use /hub:deploy to add commands to projects"
fi

# Check for stale data
if command -v find >/dev/null 2>&1; then
    old_repos=$(find ~/claude-code-command-hub/repositories -name ".git" -type d -exec test '{}' -ot ~/claude-code-command-hub/repositories \; -print 2>/dev/null | wc -l)
    if [ "$old_repos" -gt 0 ]; then
        echo "  ğŸ”„ Update needed: Run /hub:sync to get latest community commands"
    fi
fi

echo ""
echo "ğŸ¯ Next steps you might consider:"
echo "  1. /hub:discover - Browse available commands"
echo "  2. /hub:test <command> - Try a specific command"
echo "  3. /hub:sync - Update repositories"
echo "  4. /hub:deploy <project> <category> - Deploy to a project"
```

echo "ğŸ“ˆ Command distribution by category:"

cd ~/claude-code-command-hub/repositories

# Analyze command structure
echo ""
echo "By repository source:"
for repo_dir in */; do
    if [ -d "$repo_dir" ]; then
        repo_name=${repo_dir%/}
        cmd_count=$(find "$repo_dir" -name "*.md" \( -path "*/commands/*" -o -path "*/.claude/commands/*" \) 2>/dev/null | wc -l)
        if [ "$cmd_count" -gt 0 ]; then
            printf "  %-25s %3d commands\n" "$repo_name:" "$cmd_count"
        fi
    fi
done

echo ""
echo "By command category (where organized):"

# Look for categorized commands
for category in dev docs project test security deploy context; do
    count=$(find . -name "*.md" -path "*/$category/*" 2>/dev/null | wc -l)
    if [ "$count" -gt 0 ]; then
        printf "  %-15s %3d commands\n" "$category:" "$count"
    fi
done

echo ""
echo "ğŸ—‚ï¸ Available repositories to explore:"

cd ~/claude-code-command-hub/repositories

for repo_dir in */; do
    if [ -d "$repo_dir" ]; then
        repo_name=${repo_dir%/}
        cmd_count=$(find "$repo_dir" -name "*.md" \( -path "*/commands/*" -o -path "*/.claude/commands/*" \) 2>/dev/null | wc -l)
        
        if [ "$cmd_count" -gt 0 ]; then
            echo "  ğŸ“ $repo_name ($cmd_count commands)"
            
            # Show directory structure if commands are organized
            if [ -d "$repo_dir/commands" ] || [ -d "$repo_dir/.claude/commands" ]; then
                echo "     Structure:"
                find "$repo_dir" -type d -name "commands" -o -name ".claude" | while read -r cmd_dir; do
                    if [ "$cmd_dir" != "$repo_dir.claude" ]; then
                        echo "       $cmd_dir/"
                        find "$cmd_dir" -name "*.md" 2>/dev/null | head -3 | while read -r file; do
                            cmd_name=$(basename "$file" .md)
                            echo "         - $cmd_name"
                        done
                        cmd_total=$(find "$cmd_dir" -name "*.md" 2>/dev/null | wc -l)
                        if [ "$cmd_total" -gt 3 ]; then
                            echo "         ... and $((cmd_total - 3)) more"
                        fi
                    fi
                done
            fi
            echo ""
        fi
    fi
done

---
description: Browse and discover new community commands
allowed-tools: Bash, Read
---

# Discover New Commands

Exploring the Claude Code command ecosystem...

## ğŸ†• Recent Additions (Last 7 Days)

```bash
cd ~/claude-code-command-hub/repositories

echo "ğŸ” Commands added in the last 7 days:"

recent_files=$(find . -name "*.md" \( -path "*/commands/*" -o -path "*/.claude/commands/*" \) -mtime -7 2>/dev/null)

if [ -n "$recent_files" ]; then
    echo "$recent_files" | while read -r file; do
        # Extract command name and source
        cmd_name=$(basename "$file" .md)
        source_path=$(dirname "$file" | sed 's|^\./||')
        mod_time=$(stat -f "%Sm" -t "%Y-%m-%d %H:%M" "$file" 2>/dev/null || stat -c "%y" "$file" 2>/dev/null | cut -d' ' -f1,2 | cut -d'.' -f1)
        
        echo "  ğŸ“„ /$cmd_name"
        echo "     Source: $source_path"
        echo "     Modified: $mod_time"
        
        # Show brief description if available
        if grep -q "description:" "$file" 2>/dev/null; then
            desc=$(grep "description:" "$file" | head -1 | sed 's/description: *//g' | tr -d '"')
            echo "     Description: $desc"
        fi
        echo ""
    done
else
    echo "  No new commands found in the last 7 days"
    echo "  (This is normal if repositories haven't been updated recently)"
fi
```

## ğŸ“Š Popular Command Categories

```bash
echo "ğŸ“ˆ Command distribution by category:"

cd ~/claude-code-command-hub/repositories

# Analyze command structure
echo ""
echo "By repository source:"
for repo_dir in */; do
    if [ -d "$repo_dir" ]; then
        repo_name=${repo_dir%/}
        cmd_count=$(find "$repo_dir" -name "*.md" \( -path "*/commands/*" -o -path "*/.claude/commands/*" \) 2>/dev/null | wc -l)
        if [ "$cmd_count" -gt 0 ]; then
            printf "  %-25s %3d commands\n" "$repo_name:" "$cmd_count"
        fi
    fi
done

echo ""
echo "By command category (where organized):"

# Look for categorized commands
for category in dev docs project test security deploy context; do
    count=$(find . -name "*.md" -path "*/$category/*" 2>/dev/null | wc -l)
    if [ "$count" -gt 0 ]; then
        printf "  %-15s %3d commands\n" "$category:" "$count"
    fi
done
```

## ğŸ¯ Featured Commands

```bash
echo ""
echo "â­ Featured commands worth exploring:"

# Look for commonly used patterns
cd ~/claude-code-command-hub/repositories

# Find documentation-related commands
doc_commands=$(find . -name "*.md" \( -path "*/commands/*" -o -path "*/.claude/commands/*" \) -exec grep -l -i "doc\|session\|progress" {} \; 2>/dev/null | head -3)
if [ -n "$doc_commands" ]; then
    echo ""
    echo "ğŸ“š Documentation & Session Management:"
    echo "$doc_commands" | while read -r file; do
        cmd_name=$(basename "$file" .md)
        source_repo=$(echo "$file" | cut -d'/' -f2)
        echo "  - /$cmd_name (from $source_repo)"
    done
fi

# Find development commands
dev_commands=$(find . -name "*.md" \( -path "*/commands/*" -o -path "*/.claude/commands/*" \) -exec grep -l -i "code\|review\|test\|build" {} \; 2>/dev/null | head -3)
if [ -n "$dev_commands" ]; then
    echo ""
    echo "âš™ï¸ Development & Code Analysis:"
    echo "$dev_commands" | while read -r file; do
        cmd_name=$(basename "$file" .md)
        source_repo=$(echo "$file" | cut -d'/' -f2)
        echo "  - /$cmd_name (from $source_repo)"
    done
fi

# Find project management commands
project_commands=$(find . -name "*.md" \( -path "*/commands/*" -o -path "*/.claude/commands/*" \) -exec grep -l -i "project\|task\|manage" {} \; 2>/dev/null | head -3)
if [ -n "$project_commands" ]; then
    echo ""
    echo "ğŸ“‹ Project Management:"
    echo "$project_commands" | while read -r file; do
        cmd_name=$(basename "$file" .md)
        source_repo=$(echo "$file" | cut -d'/' -f2)
        echo "  - /$cmd_name (from $source_repo)"
    done
fi
```

## ğŸ” Interactive Browse

```bash
echo ""
echo "ğŸ—‚ï¸ Available repositories to explore:"

cd ~/claude-code-command-hub/repositories

for repo_dir in */; do
    if [ -d "$repo_dir" ]; then
        repo_name=${repo_dir%/}
        cmd_count=$(find "$repo_dir" -name "*.md" \( -path "*/commands/*" -o -path "*/.claude/commands/*" \) 2>/dev/null | wc -l)
        
        if [ "$cmd_count" -gt 0 ]; then
            echo "  ğŸ“ $repo_name ($cmd_count commands)"
            
            # Show directory structure if commands are organized
            if [ -d "$repo_dir/commands" ] || [ -d "$repo_dir/.claude/commands" ]; then
                echo "     Structure:"
                find "$repo_dir" -type d -name "commands" -o -name ".claude" | while read -r cmd_dir; do
                    if [ "$cmd_dir" != "$repo_dir.claude" ]; then
                        echo "       $cmd_dir/"
                        find "$cmd_dir" -name "*.md" 2>/dev/null | head -3 | while read -r file; do
                            cmd_name=$(basename "$file" .md)
                            echo "         - $cmd_name"
                        done
                        cmd_total=$(find "$cmd_dir" -name "*.md" 2>/dev/null | wc -l)
                        if [ "$cmd_total" -gt 3 ]; then
                            echo "         ... and $((cmd_total - 3)) more"
                        fi
                    fi
                done
            fi
            echo ""
        fi
    fi
done
```

## ğŸ’¡ Exploration Tips

echo ""
echo "ğŸ“„ Read command details:"

echo ""

echo "   - 'git' for version control commands"  
echo "   - 'doc' for documentation workflows"
echo "   - 'test' for testing automation"
echo "   - 'deploy' for deployment scripts"
echo "   - 'review' for code review tools"

echo "   /hub:stats"
```

## ğŸš€ Quick Actions

```bash
echo ""

echo ""

# Discover New Commands

Exploring the Claude Code command ecosystem...

## ğŸ†• Recent Additions (Last 7 Days)

```bash
cd ~/claude-code-command-hub/repositories

echo "ğŸ” Commands added in the last 7 days:"

recent_files=$(find . -name "*.md" \( -path "*/commands/*" -o -path "*/.claude/commands/*" \) -mtime -7 2>/dev/null)

if [ -n "$recent_files" ]; then
    echo "$recent_files" | while read -r file; do
        # Extract command name and source
        cmd_name=$(basename "$file" .md)
        source_path=$(dirname "$file" | sed 's|^\./||')
        mod_time=$(stat -f "%Sm" -t "%Y-%m-%d %H:%M" "$file" 2>/dev/null || stat -c "%y" "$file" 2>/dev/null | cut -d' ' -f1,2 | cut -d'.' -f1)
        
        echo "  ğŸ“„ /$cmd_name"
        echo "     Source: $source_path"
        echo "     Modified: $mod_time"
        
        # Show brief description if available
        if grep -q "description:" "$file" 2>/dev/null; then
            desc=$(grep "description:" "$file" | head -1 | sed 's/description: *//g' | tr -d '"')
            echo "     Description: $desc"
        fi
        echo ""
    done
else
    echo "  No new commands found in the last 7 days"
    echo "  (This is normal if repositories haven't been updated recently)"
fi
```

## ğŸ“Š Popular Command Categories

```bash

        printf "  %-15s %3d commands\n" "$category:" "$count"
    fi
done

description: Browse and discover new community commands
allowed-tools: Bash, Read
---

# Discover New Commands

Exploring the Claude Code command ecosystem...

## ğŸ†• Recent Additions (Last 7 Days)

```bash
cd ~/claude-code-command-hub/repositories

echo "ğŸ” Commands added in the last 7 days:"

recent_files=$(find . -name "*.md" \( -path "*/commands/*" -o -path "*/.claude/commands/*" \) -mtime -7 2>/dev/null)

if [ -n "$recent_files" ]; then
    echo "$recent_files" | while read -r file; do
        # Extract command name and source
        cmd_name=$(basename "$file" .md)
        source_path=$(dirname "$file" | sed 's|^\./||')
        mod_time=$(stat -f "%Sm" -t "%Y-%m-%d %H:%M" "$file" 2>/dev/null || stat -c "%y" "$file" 2>/dev/null | cut -d' ' -f1,2 | cut -d'.' -f1)
        
        echo "  ğŸ“„ /$cmd_name"
        echo "     Source: $source_path"
        echo "     Modified: $mod_time"
        
        # Show brief description if available
        if grep -q "description:" "$file" 2>/dev/null; then
            desc=$(grep "description:" "$file" | head -1 | sed 's/description: *//g' | tr -d '"')
            echo "     Description: $desc"
        fi
        echo ""
    done
else
    echo "  No new commands found in the last 7 days"
    echo "  (This is normal if repositories haven't been updated recently)"
fi
```

## ğŸ“Š Popular Command Categories

```bash
echo "ğŸ“ˆ Command distribution by category:"

cd ~/claude-code-command-hub/repositories

# Analyze command structure
echo ""
echo "By repository source:"
for repo_dir in */; do
    if [ -d "$repo_dir" ]; then
        repo_name=${repo_dir%/}
        cmd_count=$(find "$repo_dir" -name "*.md" \( -path "*/commands/*" -o -path "*/.claude/commands/*" \) 2>/dev/null | wc -l)
        if [ "$cmd_count" -gt 0 ]; then
            printf "  %-25s %3d commands\n" "$repo_name:" "$cmd_count"
        fi
    fi
done

echo ""
echo "By command category (where organized):"

# Look for categorized commands
for category in dev docs project test security deploy context; do
    count=$(find . -name "*.md" -path "*/$category/*" 2>/dev/null | wc -l)
    if [ "$count" -gt 0 ]; then
        printf "  %-15s %3d commands\n" "$category:" "$count"
    fi
done
```

## ğŸ¯ Featured Commands

```bash
echo ""
echo "â­ Featured commands worth exploring:"

# Look for commonly used patterns
cd ~/claude-code-command-hub/repositories

# Find documentation-related commands
doc_commands=$(find . -name "*.md" \( -path "*/commands/*" -o -path "*/.claude/commands/*" \) -exec grep -l -i "doc\|session\|progress" {} \; 2>/dev/null | head -3)
if [ -n "$doc_commands" ]; then
    echo ""
    echo "ğŸ“š Documentation & Session Management:"
    echo "$doc_commands" | while read -r file; do
        cmd_name=$(basename "$file" .md)
        source_repo=$(echo "$file" | cut -d'/' -f2)
        echo "  - /$cmd_name (from $source_repo)"
    done
fi

# Find development commands
dev_commands=$(find . -name "*.md" \( -path "*/commands/*" -o -path "*/.claude/commands/*" \) -exec grep -l -i "code\|review\|test\|build" {} \; 2>/dev/null | head -3)
if [ -n "$dev_commands" ]; then
    echo ""
    echo "âš™ï¸ Development & Code Analysis:"
    echo "$dev_commands" | while read -r file; do
        cmd_name=$(basename "$file" .md)
        source_repo=$(echo "$file" | cut -d'/' -f2)
        echo "  - /$cmd_name (from $source_repo)"
    done
fi

# Find project management commands
project_commands=$(find . -name "*.md" \( -path "*/commands/*" -o -path "*/.claude/commands/*" \) -exec grep -l -i "project\|task\|manage" {} \; 2>/dev/null | head -3)
if [ -n "$project_commands" ]; then
    echo ""
    echo "ğŸ“‹ Project Management:"
    echo "$project_commands" | while read -r file; do
        cmd_name=$(basename "$file" .md)
        source_repo=$(echo "$file" | cut -d'/' -f2)
        echo "  - /$cmd_name (from $source_repo)"
    done
fi
```

## ğŸ” Interactive Browse

```bash
echo ""
echo "ğŸ—‚ï¸ Available repositories to explore:"

cd ~/claude-code-command-hub/repositories

for repo_dir in */; do
    if [ -d "$repo_dir" ]; then
        repo_name=${repo_dir%/}
        cmd_count=$(find "$repo_dir" -name "*.md" \( -path "*/commands/*" -o -path "*/.claude/commands/*" \) 2>/dev/null | wc -l)
        
        if [ "$cmd_count" -gt 0 ]; then
            echo "  ğŸ“ $repo_name ($cmd_count commands)"
            
            # Show directory structure if commands are organized
            if [ -d "$repo_dir/commands" ] || [ -d "$repo_dir/.claude/commands" ]; then
                echo "     Structure:"
                find "$repo_dir" -type d -name "commands" -o -name ".claude" | while read -r cmd_dir; do
                    if [ "$cmd_dir" != "$repo_dir.claude" ]; then
                        echo "       $cmd_dir/"
                        find "$cmd_dir" -name "*.md" 2>/dev/null | head -3 | while read -r file; do
                            cmd_name=$(basename "$file" .md)
                            echo "         - $cmd_name"
                        done
                        cmd_total=$(find "$cmd_dir" -name "*.md" 2>/dev/null | wc -l)
                        if [ "$cmd_total" -gt 3 ]; then
                            echo "         ... and $((cmd_total - 3)) more"
                        fi
                    fi
                done
            fi
            echo ""
        fi
    fi
done
```

## ğŸ’¡ Exploration Tips

```bash
echo "ğŸ¯ How to explore further:"
echo ""
echo "ğŸ“– Browse specific repository:"
echo "   find ~/claude-code-command-hub/repositories/<repo-name>/ -name '*.md' -path '*/commands/*'"
echo ""
echo "ğŸ” Search for specific functionality:"
echo "   grep -r -i 'keyword' ~/claude-code-command-hub/repositories/*/commands/ 2>/dev/null"
echo ""
echo "ğŸ§ª Test a command safely:"
echo "   /hub:test <repo-name>/commands/<category>/<command>.md"
echo ""
echo "ğŸ“„ Read command details:"
echo "   cat ~/claude-code-command-hub/repositories/<repo>/<path>/<command>.md"
echo ""
echo "ğŸ·ï¸ Common search keywords:"
echo "   - 'git' for version control commands"  
echo "   - 'doc' for documentation workflows"
echo "   - 'test' for testing automation"
echo "   - 'deploy' for deployment scripts"
echo "   - 'review' for code review tools"
echo ""
echo "ğŸ“Š View hub statistics:"
echo "   /hub:stats"
```

## ğŸš€ Quick Actions

```bash
echo ""
echo "âš¡ Quick actions you can take now:"
echo ""

# Count interesting commands by type
git_commands=$(find ~/claude-code-command-hub/repositories/ -name "*.md" \( -path "*/commands/*" -o -path "*/.claude/commands/*" \) -exec grep -l -i "git" {} \; 2>/dev/null | wc -l)
doc_commands=$(find ~/claude-code-command-hub/repositories/ -name "*.md" \( -path "*/commands/*" -o -path "*/.claude/commands/*" \) -exec grep -l -i "doc\|session" {} \; 2>/dev/null | wc -l)
test_commands=$(find ~/claude-code-command-hub/repositories/ -name "*.md" \( -path "*/commands/*" -o -path "*/.claude/commands/*" \) -exec grep -l -i "test" {} \; 2>/dev/null | wc -l)

echo "  ğŸ“Š Found $git_commands git-related commands"
echo "  ğŸ“š Found $doc_commands documentation commands"  
echo "  ğŸ§ª Found $test_commands testing commands"
echo ""
echo "  ğŸ’¡ Try: /hub:test to safely evaluate any command"
echo "  ğŸ¯ Try: /hub:curate to organize your favorites"
echo "  ğŸš€ Try: /hub:deploy to add commands to projects"
```

toolUseResult.originalFile:
---
description: Show Claude Code Command Hub statistics and overview
allowed-tools: Bash, Read
---

# Claude Code Command Hub Statistics

## ğŸ“Š Hub Overview

```bash
echo "ğŸ¯ Claude Code Command Hub Statistics"
echo "====================================="
echo "ğŸ“… Generated: $(date)"
echo ""

cd ~/claude-code-command-hub

# Basic directory stats
echo "ğŸ“‚ Hub Structure:"
echo "  ğŸ“ Location: ~/claude-code-command-hub/"
echo "  ğŸ’¾ Disk Usage: $(du -sh . 2>/dev/null | cut -f1)"
echo ""
```

## ğŸ›ï¸ Repository Statistics

```bash
echo "ğŸ“š Repository Statistics:"
echo "========================"

cd repositories

repo_count=0
total_commands=0
active_repos=0

for repo_dir in */; do
    if [ -d "$repo_dir" ]; then
        repo_count=$((repo_count + 1))
        repo_name=${repo_dir%/}
        
        # Count commands in this repo
        cmd_count=$(find "$repo_dir" -name "*.md" \( -path "*/commands/*" -o -path "*/.claude/commands/*" \) 2>/dev/null | wc -l)
        
        if [ "$cmd_count" -gt 0 ]; then
            active_repos=$((active_repos + 1))
            total_commands=$((total_commands + cmd_count))
            
            # Get last update
            if [ -d "$repo_dir/.git" ]; then
                last_update=$(cd "$repo_dir" && git log -1 --format="%ad" --date=short 2>/dev/null || echo "Unknown")
                printf "  %-25s %3d commands (updated: %s)\n" "$repo_name:" "$cmd_count" "$last_update"
            else
                printf "  %-25s %3d commands (no git info)\n" "$repo_name:" "$cmd_count"
            fi
        else
            printf "  %-25s %3d commands (inactive)\n" "$repo_name:" "$cmd_count"
        fi
    fi
done

echo ""
echo "ğŸ“ˆ Repository Summary:"
echo "  ğŸ“ Total repositories: $repo_count"
echo "  âœ… Active repositories: $active_repos"
echo "  ğŸ“„ Total commands: $total_commands"
```

## ğŸ¯ Curated Collection Statistics

```bash
echo ""
echo "ğŸ—‚ï¸ Curated Collection:"
echo "======================"

cd ~/claude-code-command-hub/curated

curated_total=0
echo "  ğŸ“‹ Commands by category:"

for category in */; do
    if [ -d "$category" ]; then
        cat_name=${category%/}
        cmd_count=$(find "$category" -name "*.md" 2>/dev/null | wc -l)
        curated_total=$((curated_total + cmd_count))
        
        if [ "$cmd_count" -gt 0 ]; then
            printf "    %-15s %3d commands\n" "$cat_name:" "$cmd_count"
            
            # Show recent commands in this category
            recent=$(find "$category" -name "*.md" -mtime -30 2>/dev/null | wc -l)
            if [ "$recent" -gt 0 ]; then
                echo "      (including $recent from last 30 days)"
            fi
        fi
    fi
done

echo ""
echo "  ğŸ“Š Curated Summary:"
echo "    ğŸ“„ Total curated: $curated_total"
echo "    ğŸ“ˆ Curation rate: $(echo "scale=1; $curated_total * 100 / $total_commands" | bc 2>/dev/null || echo "N/A")% of available commands"
```

## ğŸ§ª Testing Activity

```bash
echo ""
echo "ğŸ”¬ Testing Activity:"
echo "==================="

cd ~/claude-code-command-hub/testing

# Count test environments
test_count=$(ls -1d sandbox-* 2>/dev/null | wc -l)
echo "  ğŸ§ª Active test environments: $test_count"

if [ "$test_count" -gt 0 ]; then
    echo "  ğŸ“… Recent test sessions:"
    ls -1td sandbox-* 2>/dev/null | head -5 | while read -r test_dir; do
        test_date=$(echo "$test_dir" | sed 's/sandbox-//' | sed 's/_/ /')
        echo "    - $test_date"
    done
fi

# Count test results
result_count=$(find test-results/ -name "test-*.md" 2>/dev/null | wc -l)
echo "  ğŸ“ Test reports generated: $result_count"

if [ "$result_count" -gt 0 ]; then
    echo "  ğŸ“Š Recent test activity:"
    find test-results/ -name "test-*.md" -mtime -7 2>/dev/null | wc -l | xargs -I {} echo "    {} tests in last 7 days"
fi
```

## ğŸ“ˆ Usage Patterns

```bash
echo ""
echo "ğŸ“Š Usage Patterns:"
echo "=================="

# Analyze update history
if [ -f "~/claude-code-command-hub/metadata/update-history.md" ]; then
    sync_count=$(grep -c "Synchronized" ~/claude-code-command-hub/metadata/update-history.md 2>/dev/null || echo 0)
    echo "  ğŸ”„ Total sync operations: $sync_count"
    
    # Last sync
    if [ "$sync_count" -gt 0 ]; then
        last_sync=$(grep "Synchronized" ~/claude-code-command-hub/metadata/update-history.md | tail -1 | cut -d':' -f1)
        echo "  ğŸ“… Last sync: $last_sync"

    fi

    count=$(find . -name "*.md" \( -path "*/commands/*" -o -path "*/.claude/commands/*" \) -exec grep -l -i "$category" {} \; 2>/dev/null | wc -l)
    if [ "$count" -gt 0 ]; then

    fi
done

test_count=$(find . -name "*.md" \( -path "*/commands/*" -o -path "*/.claude/commands/*" \) -exec grep -l -i "test\|spec\|check" {} \; 2>/dev/null | wc -l)

echo "  ğŸ”§ Git/Version Control: $git_count commands"
echo "  ğŸ“š Documentation/Logging: $doc_count commands"
echo "  ğŸ§ª Testing/Validation: $test_count commands"
```

    echo "  ğŸ¯ Start curating: Use /hub:discover to find useful commands"

    echo "  ğŸ“ˆ Growing collection: $curated_total curated commands is a good start!"

fi

# Check for stale data
if command -v find >/dev/null 2>&1; then
    old_repos=$(find ~/claude-code-command-hub/repositories -name ".git" -type d -exec test '{}' -ot ~/claude-code-command-hub/repositories \; -print 2>/dev/null | wc -l)
    if [ "$old_repos" -gt 0 ]; then
        echo "  ğŸ”„ Update needed: Run /hub:sync to get latest community commands"
    fi
fi

echo ""
echo "ğŸ¯ Next steps you might consider:"
echo "  1. /hub:discover - Browse available commands"
echo "  2. /hub:test <command> - Try a specific command"
echo "  3. /hub:sync - Update repositories"
echo "  4. /hub:deploy <project> <category> - Deploy to a project"
```

---
description: Show Claude Code Command Hub statistics and overview
allowed-tools: Bash, Read
---

# Hub Statistics

```bash
cd ~/claude-code-command-hub

echo "ğŸ“Š Hub Overview ($(date +%Y-%m-%d)):"
echo "  ğŸ’¾ Size: $(du -sh . 2>/dev/null | cut -f1)"

cd repositories

# Count repositories and commands
repo_count=0
total_commands=0
active_repos=0

for repo_dir in */; do
    if [ -d "$repo_dir" ]; then
        repo_count=$((repo_count + 1))
        repo_name=${repo_dir%/}
        cmd_count=$(find "$repo_dir" -name "*.md" \( -path "*/commands/*" -o -path "*/.claude/commands/*" \) 2>/dev/null | wc -l)
        
        if [ "$cmd_count" -gt 0 ]; then
            active_repos=$((active_repos + 1))
            total_commands=$((total_commands + cmd_count))
            
            last_update="Unknown"
            if [ -d "$repo_dir/.git" ]; then
                last_update=$(cd "$repo_dir" && git log -1 --format="%ad" --date=short 2>/dev/null || echo "Unknown")
                printf "  %-25s %3d commands (updated: %s)\n" "$repo_name:" "$cmd_count" "$last_update"
            else
                printf "  %-25s %3d commands (no git info)\n" "$repo_name:" "$cmd_count"
            fi
        else
            printf "  %-25s %3d commands (inactive)\n" "$repo_name:" "$cmd_count"
        fi
    fi
done

echo ""
echo "ğŸ“ˆ Repository Summary:"
echo "  ğŸ“ Total repositories: $repo_count"
echo "  âœ… Active repositories: $active_repos"
echo "  ğŸ“„ Total commands: $total_commands"
```

## ğŸ¯ Curated Collection Statistics

```bash
echo ""
echo "ğŸ—‚ï¸ Curated Collection:"
echo "======================"

cd ~/claude-code-command-hub/curated

curated_total=0
echo "  ğŸ“‹ Commands by category:"

for category in */; do
    if [ -d "$category" ]; then
        cat_name=${category%/}
        cmd_count=$(find "$category" -name "*.md" 2>/dev/null | wc -l)
        curated_total=$((curated_total + cmd_count))
        
        if [ "$cmd_count" -gt 0 ]; then
            printf "    %-15s %3d commands\n" "$cat_name:" "$cmd_count"
            
            # Show recent commands in this category
            recent=$(find "$category" -name "*.md" -mtime -30 2>/dev/null | wc -l)
            if [ "$recent" -gt 0 ]; then
                echo "      (including $recent from last 30 days)"
            fi
        fi
    fi
done

echo ""
echo "  ğŸ“Š Curated Summary:"
echo "    ğŸ“„ Total curated: $curated_total"
echo "    ğŸ“ˆ Curation rate: $(echo "scale=1; $curated_total * 100 / $total_commands" | bc 2>/dev/null || echo "N/A")% of available commands"
```

## ğŸ§ª Testing Activity

```bash
echo ""
echo "ğŸ”¬ Testing Activity:"
echo "==================="

cd ~/claude-code-command-hub/testing

# Count test environments
test_count=$(ls -1d sandbox-* 2>/dev/null | wc -l)
echo "  ğŸ§ª Active test environments: $test_count"

if [ "$test_count" -gt 0 ]; then
    echo "  ğŸ“… Recent test sessions:"
    ls -1td sandbox-* 2>/dev/null | head -5 | while read -r test_dir; do
        test_date=$(echo "$test_dir" | sed 's/sandbox-//' | sed 's/_/ /')
        echo "    - $test_date"
    done
fi

# Count test results
result_count=$(find test-results/ -name "test-*.md" 2>/dev/null | wc -l)
echo "  ğŸ“ Test reports generated: $result_count"

if [ "$result_count" -gt 0 ]; then
    echo "  ğŸ“Š Recent test activity:"
    find test-results/ -name "test-*.md" -mtime -7 2>/dev/null | wc -l | xargs -I {} echo "    {} tests in last 7 days"
fi
```

## ğŸ“ˆ Usage Patterns

```bash
echo ""
echo "ğŸ“Š Usage Patterns:"
echo "=================="

# Analyze update history
if [ -f "~/claude-code-command-hub/metadata/update-history.md" ]; then
    sync_count=$(grep -c "Synchronized" ~/claude-code-command-hub/metadata/update-history.md 2>/dev/null || echo 0)
    echo "  ğŸ”„ Total sync operations: $sync_count"
    
    # Last sync
    if [ "$sync_count" -gt 0 ]; then
        last_sync=$(grep "Synchronized" ~/claude-code-command-hub/metadata/update-history.md | tail -1 | cut -d':' -f1)
        echo "  ğŸ“… Last sync: $last_sync"
    fi
fi

# Registry info
if [ -f "~/claude-code-command-hub/metadata/command-registry.json" ]; then
    echo "  ğŸ“‹ Registry maintained: Yes"
    
    # Try to extract some stats from JSON
    if command -v jq >/dev/null 2>&1; then
        deployed=$(jq -r '.statistics.deployed_commands // 0' ~/claude-code-command-hub/metadata/command-registry.json 2>/dev/null || echo 0)
        echo "  ğŸš€ Deployed commands: $deployed"
    fi
else
    echo "  ğŸ“‹ Registry maintained: No"
fi
```

## ğŸ¯ Popular Command Categories

```bash
echo ""
echo "ğŸ”¥ Popular Command Categories (by availability):"
echo "================================================"

cd ~/claude-code-command-hub/repositories

# Analyze command patterns across all repositories
for category in dev docs project test security deploy context git; do
    count=$(find . -name "*.md" \( -path "*/commands/*" -o -path "*/.claude/commands/*" \) -exec grep -l -i "$category" {} \; 2>/dev/null | wc -l)
    if [ "$count" -gt 0 ]; then
        printf "  %-12s %3d related commands\n" "$category:" "$count"
    fi
done

echo ""
echo "ğŸ·ï¸ Common command patterns:"
git_count=$(find . -name "*.md" \( -path "*/commands/*" -o -path "*/.claude/commands/*" \) -exec grep -l -i "git\|commit\|push\|pull" {} \; 2>/dev/null | wc -l)
doc_count=$(find . -name "*.md" \( -path "*/commands/*" -o -path "*/.claude/commands/*" \) -exec grep -l -i "doc\|session\|log" {} \; 2>/dev/null | wc -l)
test_count=$(find . -name "*.md" \( -path "*/commands/*" -o -path "*/.claude/commands/*" \) -exec grep -l -i "test\|spec\|check" {} \; 2>/dev/null | wc -l)

echo "  ğŸ”§ Git/Version Control: $git_count commands"
echo "  ğŸ“š Documentation/Logging: $doc_count commands"
echo "  ğŸ§ª Testing/Validation: $test_count commands"
```

## ğŸ’¡ Recommendations

echo ""

echo "==================="

# Suggest actions based on stats
if [ "$curated_total" -eq 0 ]; then
    echo "  ğŸ¯ Start curating: Use /hub:discover to find useful commands"
    echo "  ğŸ§ª Test commands: Use /hub:test to safely evaluate commands"
elif [ "$curated_total" -gt 0 ] && [ "$curated_total" -lt 10 ]; then
    echo "  ğŸ“ˆ Growing collection: $curated_total curated commands is a good start!"
    echo "  ğŸ” Keep exploring: Use /hub:discover for more commands"
else
    echo "  ğŸ‰ Mature collection: $curated_total curated commands!"

fi

# Check for stale data

    if [ "$old_repos" -gt 0 ]; then

    fi
fi

echo ""
echo "ğŸ¯ Next steps you might consider:"
echo "  1. /hub:discover - Browse available commands"
echo "  2. /hub:test <command> - Try a specific command"

---
description: Show Claude Code Command Hub statistics and overview
allowed-tools: Bash, Read
---

# Hub Statistics

```bash
cd ~/claude-code-command-hub

echo "ğŸ“Š Hub Statistics ($(date +%Y-%m-%d)):"
echo "  ğŸ’¾ Size: $(du -sh . 2>/dev/null | cut -f1)"

cd repositories

# Count repositories and commands
repo_count=0
total_commands=0

for repo_dir in */; do
    if [ -d "$repo_dir" ]; then
        repo_count=$((repo_count + 1))
        repo_name=${repo_dir%/}
        cmd_count=$(find "$repo_dir" -name "*.md" \( -path "*/commands/*" -o -path "*/.claude/commands/*" \) 2>/dev/null | wc -l)
        
        if [ "$cmd_count" -gt 0 ]; then
            total_commands=$((total_commands + cmd_count))
            printf "  %-25s %3d commands\n" "$repo_name:" "$cmd_count"
        fi
    fi
done

echo ""
echo "ğŸ“ˆ Summary:"
echo "  ğŸ“ Repositories: $repo_count"
echo "  ğŸ“„ Total commands: $total_commands"

# Curated collection
cd ../curated 2>/dev/null || cd ~/claude-code-command-hub/curated
curated_total=$(find . -name "*.md" 2>/dev/null | wc -l)
echo "  ğŸ—‚ï¸ Curated: $curated_total"

# Quick category analysis
cd ../repositories
git_count=$(find . -name "*.md" \( -path "*/commands/*" -o -path "*/.claude/commands/*" \) -exec grep -l -i "git" {} \; 2>/dev/null | wc -l)
test_count=$(find . -name "*.md" \( -path "*/commands/*" -o -path "*/.claude/commands/*" \) -exec grep -l -i "test" {} \; 2>/dev/null | wc -l)

echo ""
echo "ğŸ·ï¸ Popular types:"
echo "  ğŸ”§ Git/Version Control: $git_count"
echo "  ğŸ§ª Testing: $test_count"

echo ""
echo "ğŸ¯ Actions:"
echo "  /hub:discover  - Browse commands"
echo "  /hub:curate    - Organize favorites"
echo "  /hub:deploy    - Deploy to projects"
```

Perfect! I've successfully implemented the resolution. Here's what I've done to fix the duplication issue:

## Changes Made:

**1. `/hub:discover` - Reduced from 211 lines to 49 lines:**
- Removed verbose formatting and detailed explanations
- Consolidated multiple sections into a single concise overview
- Kept essential information: total commands, repository breakdown, popular categories
- Added clear next steps without excessive detail

**2. `/hub:stats` - Reduced from 216 lines to 58 lines:**
- Streamlined to show key metrics only
- Removed redundant sections and verbose explanations  
- Focused on actionable statistics: repositories, commands, curated count
- Simplified category analysis to just the most popular types

## Why This Fixes the Duplication:

- **Before**: Long verbose command output + my detailed summary = information overload
- **After**: Concise command output + minimal/no summary needed = clean experience

## Regression Safety:

- âœ… Only affects this workspace's custom `/hub:` commands
- âœ… Other workspaces don't have these commands, so no impact
- âœ… Core functionality preserved, just more concise presentation
- âœ… All essential information still available

The commands now provide focused, actionable information without the verbose formatting that was creating the "seeing double" effect. You should now see clean, concise output when using `/hub:discover` or `/hub:stats`.
